title: Understanding Interdisciplinary Research in Educational Technology: Mobile Microlearning-Based Short-Term Course

context.prior_knowledge: General understanding of educational technology fundamentals and related fields (psychology, communication, etc.)
context.additional_context: Learners are university members with professional backgrounds (medical/legal/technical), exploring interdisciplinary approaches for learning and performance improvement. They engage in short-term intensive learning via mobile devices in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the interdisciplinary nature of educational technology by connecting it to at least three adjacent fields (e.g., psychology, communication, business administration)
Through literature analysis, learners can identify at least five cases of research collaboration between educational technology and other fields and summarize key themes.
Learners can propose interdisciplinary approaches to learning and innovation for organizational performance improvement, applying them to real-world cases (e.g., healthcare/technology sectors).

resources: Core Literature Database in Educational Technology

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
